relation: It is not a well lit campus and finding a parking space can be challenging.
You will have absolutely no time for fun. Each quarter has a semester worth of information crammed into it.
There is a cooking program at this school with a restaurant on campus.
Harder than it needs to be.

If you are thinking about going through a program at this school, check your program requirements. You may have to leave the state to do a 3 to 6 month internship. It would be less stressful to have $5,000 in the bank for moving/living expenses before you begin. There is no system in place for affordable housing while away. You are on your own.
The sonography programs are not specialty-oriented. There is a great deal of unnecessary book learning unrelated to your field and not enough practical application.

textAfterTable: Jennifer from Spokane, WA 12/05/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 34 Categories Comments Great for these types of students For people who want to have fun while getting an education! There are so many different people here! I have people in my class that are in their 60's and 70's, but a majority are under 40. Teachers are extremely understanding to those with children as well! Tips for prospective students Get your financial aid in early!!! There are a lot of students who apply so it takes the financial aid office a while to process them all. And make sure you talk with a counselor from the program that you're interested in because pre-reqs for courses and transfers can sometimes differ. Bang for the buck It's community college so it's cheaper than a four year! Am enjoying being here The campus is awesome! The cafe makes superb food,
